snippet: Eliot Spitzer is promising to spend plenty on the race for New York City comptroller without revealing where it comes from.
abstract: Editorial calls on Eliot Spitzer, candidate for New York City comptroller, to release complete income tax returns, arguing that he is attempting to hide extent of his personal wealth from city voters; contends Spitzer's refusal to release information, and his decision to use personal fortune rather than city's public financing system, fly in face of values he espoused when he was attorney general and governor.
lead_paragraph: Eliot Spitzer is promising to spend plenty on the race for New York City comptroller without revealing where it comes from.
